name: BugsPHP
description: a dataset for automated program repair in PHP

name: Minecraft
description: a benchmark with C/C++, Java, and Python programs constructed via automated mining of software bug fixes with precise code context

name: growingBugs
description: a benchmark for Java defects providing easy-to-use interfaces similar to Defects4J

name: Vul4J
description: a dataset of reproducible Java vulnerabilities

name: FixJS
description: a dataset of bug-fixing JavaScript commits

name: ITSP
description: a parallel corpus of 661 buggy-repaired program pairs submitted by CS-1 students for 74 unique assignments spread across 10 course weeks

name: BugsInPy
description: a database of existing bugs in Python programs to enable controlled testing and debugging studies

name: BugsJS
description: a benchmark of 453 real, manually validated JavaScript bugs from 10 popular JavaScript server-side programs

name: Defexts
description: a curated dataset of reproducible real-world bugs for modern JVM languages (Kotlin, Groovy, Scala)

name: Refactory
description: a dataset of 1783 buggy and 2442 correct student submissions for 5 Python programming assignments

name: BugSwarm
description: a dataset of thousands of real software bugs and their fixes

name: Bears
description: an extensible Java bug benchmark for automatic program repair studies

name: DroixBench
description: a collection of 24 reproducible crashes in open-source Android apps

name: Bugs.jar
description: a large-scale, diverse dataset of bugs for Java program repair

name: QuixBugs
description: a parallel corpus of 40 programs in both Python and Java, each with a bug on one line

name: DBGBench
description: 291 (in)correct patches from real software professionals for 27 real bugs in C for the qualitative evaluation of automated repair techniques

name: Bugs-C++ (pronounced Bugsy)
description: A dockerized benchmark/infrastructure for C/C++ defects providing easy-to-use interfaces similar to Defects4J

name: Codeflaws
description: 3902 bugs from Codeforces programming competition for evaluating program repair tools across different defect classes

name: C-Pack-IPAs
description: A C90 Program Benchmark of Introductory Programming Assignments (IPAs), that contains semantically correct, semantically incorrect, and syntactically incorrect programs and a test suite for each IPA.

name: ManyBugs
description: automated program repair benchmark that consists of 185 defects from large popular open-source projects

name: IntroClass
description: automated program repair benchmark that consists of 998 defects in small student-written programming assignments

name: Defects4J
description: a database of existing faults to enable controlled testing studies for Java

name: GitBug-Java
description: A Reproducible Benchmark of Recent Java Bugs (199 bugs from 2023)
